page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: Renfrew consists of both private and public housing. In common with most of Scotland the majority of houses are rented from the local authority. Most of it was built in the post war period and consists of mainly terraced or new tenement type housing. The most recent development,however, is in the private sector. Two estates, Deanpark and Deanfield have been built on the site of the old airport and former golf course. They consist of detached and semi-detached property and are open plan. Their closeness to the motorway and Airport make them popular with businessmen and commuters to Glasgow and Paisley. Nearer the town centre are a number of privately owned substantial sandstone properties. There re three sheltered housing complexes for the elderly.
